business.headline: RBI MPC rate decision on August 6: Time, expectations, and key updatesRBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra will present the monetary policy statement today. Check time, expectations, and key updates.

Anil Ambani likely to be summoned again by ED for questioning: SourcesAnil Ambani faced questioning by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with an alleged Rs 17,000 crore loan fraud case. The questioning lasted for several hours, with sources indicating that he is likely to be summoned again within seven to ten days.

Anil Ambani seeks 10 days from ED to provide documents in fraud cases: SourcesThe 66-year-old industrialist was summoned to the ED headquarters in New Delhi, where his statement was recorded under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

Want higher FD returns? Compare these 1-year rates before investingAmong the different time periods you can choose, a one-year FD is especially attractive. It gives you decent interest without locking up your money for too long.

Why Estonia is the new favourite for Indian startupsAccording to an investment banker, top business leaders have already adopted Estonia's unique e-residency, allowing them to do business across Europe.

Sensex ends over 308 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Titan up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex ended the session 308.47 points lower at 80,710.25, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 73.20 points to settle at 24,649.55. All the broader market indices ended the trading session in negative territory after Trump said he would impose more tariffs on India over Russian oil imports.
How one tax mistake could have cost a real estate seller Rs 1.87 lakhReal estate sellers often ignore deductions that can help reduce capital gains tax.

Why the government wants to blend more ethanol with petrolBy March 2025, the government hit its E20 blending target—20% ethanol in petrol—five years ahead of schedule. Average blending levels stood at 17.98% in February 2025, up from 14.6% the year before, according to official data.

Filing ITR for the first time? Do this before anything elseThe last date to file your ITR for the financial year 2024–25 is September 15, 2025, so it's best to begin early and avoid the last-minute rush.

PAN 2.0 to go live in 18 months: What it means and how it affects youThe Rs 1,435 crore project will focus on simplifying taxpayer registration services and improving the overall experience through a new, unified online platform.

Why is Trump threatening India over Russian oil? Here's the real reasonIs Donald Trump really upset about India buying Russian oil, or is this just a calculated move to boost US energy exports, appease oil lobbyists, and reshape global trade flows?

Who is P B Balaji, Jaguar Land Rover's new CEO?The decision was confirmed in a stock exchange filing on August 4, 2025. Balaji's appointment marks a major shift, as he moves from a financial leadership role to the driver's seat of one of the world's most recognised car brands.

entertainment.headline: Mahavatar Narsimha box office Day 12: Historic run continues for top animated hitDirector Ashwin Kumar's 'Mahavatar Narsimha' is not showing any signs of slowing down at the box office. The film surpassed the Rs 100 crore-mark (nett) at the box office in India and is still holding strong.

Women feared me off-screen too, says actor Gulshan GroverGulshan Grover, famously known as Bollywood's 'Bad Man', revealed how his villainous roles once created real-life misconceptions, especially among women. He will be seen next in 'Heer Express'.

Ozzy Osbourne died of cardiac arrest and Parkinson's, cause of death report filedOzzy Osbourne died due to cardiac complications linked to Parkinson's disease. His daughter, Aimee Osbourne, filed his death certificate in London.

Sara Ali Khan heartbroken over Uttarkashi cloudburst: Praying for safety, healingA cloudburst-triggered flash floods hit Uttarkashi, causing fatalities and destruction in Uttarkhand. Actor Sara Ali Khan was distraught seeing the visual and expressed her condolences on Instagram.
Lady Gaga, Bruno Mars top 2025 MTV VMA nominations listLady Gaga leads 2025 MTV VMA nominations with 12, followed by Bruno Mars. Voting open ahead of the September 7 broadcast.

Mohit Suri on making Saiyaara over Aashiqui 3: No pressure of sequel, opening dayDirector Mohit Suri reveals why he did not direct Aashiqui 3 and shares insights about making Saiyaara. He highlights the freedom from sequel pressure and praises Anurag Basu for taking over the project.

Mahavatar Narsimha OTT release: Makers urge fans to stay away from rumoursMahavatar Narsimha is currently playing exclusively in theatres worldwide with no OTT deal finalised. The makers urge audiences to trust only official updates amid OTT release rumours.

Aanand L Rai, Dhanush to take legal action over Raanjhanaa's AI-altered endingAanand L Rai recently shared how the team is thinking to adopting the legal route for the AI-altered version of their film 'Raanjhanaa'. Their current concern is the unauthorised modification of the film that has created a buzz around.

Hrithik Roshan explains why he rejected 3 Idiots, Dil Chahta Hai. WatchBollywood actor Hrithik Roshan reflects on the missed chances and praises Aamir Khan's performance in various films like '3 Idiots' and 'Dil Chahta Hai'. He is now looking forward to an exciting new chapter with his upcoming projects.

Jr NTR speaks legacy, and why he pushes his sons to write their own future scriptWhile Jr NTR awaits the release of 'War 2', he speaks in an interview about his family's legacy, the future of his children, and what he wants to be remembered for.
Kannada actor Santhosh Balaraj dies at 34 after battling jaundiceKannada actor Santhosh Balaraj died on Tuesday in Bengaluru. He was undergoing treatment for jaundice for several weeks.

Is BTS' Jungkook teaming up with Charlie Puth again? J-Hope suggests soBTS members are currently in the United States working on a new album alongside talented producers and composers, with the release scheduled for 2026. A new video shared by J-Hope hints at a potential collaboration between Jungkook and Charlie Puth.

You've taken it too far, says Hrithik Roshan as Jr NTR sends War 2 actor a billboardThe playful challenge between actors Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR escalated on August 5, when Roshan revealed that Jr NTR had sent a billboard to his home. Responding to the gesture, Roshan joked that the challenge had gone too far and hinted at a comeback.

Farhan Akhtar backs Raanjhanaa director amid AI row: My loyalty lies with creatorFarhan Akhtar shared his views on the AI-altered version of Aanand L Rai and Dhanush's film, 'Raanjhanaa'. The actor extended his support to the creativity of the film.

5 powerful teen dramas that explore real struggles beyond high schoolTeen dramas aren't just about crushes and cliches any more. These shows dive deep into the real, raw challenges of growing up today.

Actor Urvashi questions her National Award win: Yet to decide if I should acceptVeteran actor Urvashi expressed disappointment over being awarded in the supporting category despite playing lead in 'Ullozhukku' at the 71st National Film Awards. She awaits the jury's explanation before deciding on accepting the National Award.
Is Kumkum Bhagya going off-air after 11 years?Zee TV's 'Kumkum Bhagya' is reportedly going off-air after 11 years. The show might make way new shows like 'Ganga Mai Ki Betiyaan'.

Ajay Devgn's loving post for Kajol on 51st birthday comes with an eye-roll warningOn the occasion of Kajol's birthday, actor Ajay Devgn shared a cheeky post on Instagram. He called Kajol 'his favourite' while extending birthday wishes. Kajol turned 51 on Tuesday.

Janaki V vs State of Kerala on OTT: When and where to watch Suresh Gopi's film'Janaki V vs State of Kerala', featuring Union Minister Suresh Gopi and Anupama Parameswaran, is now set to premiere on OTT from August 15. The legal drama, inspired by true events and highlighting a survivor's fight for justice.

general news.headline: Trump was asked about US's uranium buys from Russia. Here's his responseIndia said that the United States continues to import key materials from Russia, including uranium hexafluoride for its nuclear industry, palladium for electric vehicles, as well as fertilisers and chemicals.
Ajit Doval in Moscow amid Trump's fresh tariff threat for Russia oil buysAccording to a source, the visit is part of a planned schedule and will focus on defence cooperation between India and Russia.

Heavy rain alert in Uttarakhand after flash flood fury kills 4; rescue ops onRescue operations in Uttarkashi have been severely hampered by continuous rain. The Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for heavy rain today in several districts of the state.

Trump is Making China Cheaper AgainTrump's tariff of up to 40% on transshipped goods and levies across Southeast Asia has left China a winner. Manufacturers and exporters are asking why they should move out of China. Ironically, Trump's trade war might be doing the unthinkable — making Chinese factories and products cheaper.

India's Jasprit Bumrah dilemma: Protect the body or preserve his magicJasprit Bumrah and the Indian team management might be on the brink of facing an impossible choice with trade-offs coming in both ends as the premier pacer continues to be binded down by limitations in terms of appearances or workload.

Live: Heavy rain continues to batter Uttarakhand, Kedarnath Yatra suspendedUttarkashi Cloudburst Live: At least four people died and several others went missing after a cloudburst triggered flash floods in Uttarkashi's Dharali area on Tuesday. Rescue teams from the police, Army, NDRF, and SDRF were deployed. Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami cut short his Andhra Pradesh visit and returned to Dehradun to review the situation at the State Emergency Operation Centre. He said 130 people stranded in affected areas had been shifted to safer locations, and instructions were issued for immediate food, shelter and medical aid. Additional Army helicopters have been requested to speed up rescue efforts. Schools and educational institutions remain closed in multiple districts. Follow indiatoday.in for all Live Updates.

Don't burn ties with India: Nikki Haley on Trump's tariff threat over Russian oilThe Republican leader also called out the Trump administration's duplicity, highlighting a soft-handling of trade with China in which the US paused the tariffs for 90 days.

Can Chirag Paswan pack a power punch in Bihar polls?In Bihar's liminal political spaces—between the BJP's leadership deficit and the JD(U)'s ebbing influence—Chirag Paswan sees a fault line ripe for exploitation

Six years after Article 370: What would statehood change for J&K?The extensive discretion and powers granted to the LG, as the administrator representing the President, will be removed. The authority over police, law and order, bureaucratic transfers, and anti-corruption agencies will return to the elected government.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

Brazil's Lula says will not call Trump, strengthen ties with Modi and XiThe remark comes amid intensifying diplomatic tensions between the two nations over Washington's decision to impose a 50% tariff on Brazilian imports.

Trump's White House rooftop moment: A walk and nuclear missile quipUS President Donald Trump made a surprise appearance on the White House rooftop, chatting with reporters, touring with an architect, and joking about nuclear missiles.

Mukesh Kumar is a bowler for all formats: Ganguly on pacer's England Test snubFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly said that Mukesh Kumar is well-suited to bowl across all three formats and backed the pacer to be in contention for a spot in India's squad for the 2025 Asia Cup.

Video: MNS workers storm Nagpur bank, assault staff for action against labourerA video of the MNS workers slapping a staff member, raising slogans, defacing the bank premises and creating a ruckus has gone viral on social media.

The fall of the Awami League government: The single causeThe systematic silencing and marginalisation of dedicated workers of the Sheikh Hasina-led Awami League helped bring down a government once propped up by them.

Trump is hitting India to show MAGA he's hitting RussiaDonald Trump vowed to keep America out of wars, but the Ukraine conflict has left that promise in tatters. Now, by slapping tariffs on India, he is trying to convince MAGA that he is acting against Russia, even though the move does little beyond raising costs at home and straining ties with New Delhi.
PM Modi's 'Pakistani sister' prepares handmade rakhi, awaits invitationBorn in Karachi, Pakistan, Qamar Mohsin Sheikh has been tying rakhi to PM Modi for the last 30 years.

To the Moon, on China's back: Pakistan eyes lunar landing by 2035Pakistan aims to land on the Moon by 2035, but the mission hinges entirely on China's support. Its space agency has never carried out an independent launch and relies heavily on Chinese technology and expertise. Before that, Pakistan also hopes to send its first astronaut to China's space station by 2026.

Trump says JD Vance 'most likely' MAGA successor for 2028US President Donald Trump signalled JD Vance as the "most likely" MAGA successor for 2028, while also suggesting Marco Rubio could play a major role in the GOP's future leadership.

OceanGate CEO blamed for Titan implosion, Coast Guard says it was preventableA US Coast Guard report blames OceanGate CEO Stockton Rush for ignoring safety warnings before the Titan sub-implosion, calling the company's practices flawed and potentially criminal.

Maharashtra to file review petition to bring back elephant Madhuri to KolhapurOn July 16, 2025, the Bombay High Court ordered Madhuri's relocation to Vantara, a wildlife rehabilitation centre in Jamnagar in Gujarat, run by the Reliance Foundation.

Daavudi to Hrudayam Lopala: Are songs becoming a burden to Telugu cinema?From the removal of the much-loved 'Hrudayam Lopala' in 'Kingdom' to viral tracks like 'Daavudi' in 'Devara Part 1' and 'Pippi Pippi Dum Dum' in 'Kuberaa' being left out of final cuts, this growing trend signals a shift in how music fits into mainstream storytelling.

sports.headline: From 4–1 to 2–2: How England let a glorious Test series win slip awayThe Test series between England and India ended in a 2-2 draw, but the hosts could well have won it 4-1. Having squandered golden opportunities for victory at Old Trafford and the Kennington Oval, England now must face the harsh reality of making some big changes with the Ashes on the horizon.

Siddhant Sharma and Harsh Tyagi's journey fuels Outer Delhi Warriors in DPL 2025From the dusty maidans of Delhi to the leadership roles in DPL 2025, Siddhant Sharma and Harsh Tyagi have walked a path built on patience, perseverance, and passion. Their journeys reflect the unseen grind behind every rising star in Indian domestic cricket.

Pant makes heartfelt gesture, pays college fees for underprivileged studentRishabh Pant extended a generous helping hand to support the education of a student from a financially struggling family in Karnataka's Bagalkot district. After word reached about the student's need, Pant paid the fees directly to the college.

Siraj a role model for pacers on managing workload: Sourav GangulyENG vs IND: Former Indian captain Sourav Ganguly, in an interview with Aaj Tak, heaped praise on Mohammed Siraj, who finished the Test series against England as the leading wicket-taker with 23 scalps to his name from five games.

Sourav Ganguly to enter race for Bengal cricket's presidential electionFormer Indian captain Sourav Ganguly confirmed to India Today that he will be submitting his nomination ahead of the Annual General Meeting (AGM) to contest for the post of President of the Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB).

Boys were brilliant throughout last two months: Gambhir on England tourENG vs IND: Head coach of the Indian cricket team, Gautam Gambhir, hailed the entire team's performances throughout their recent tour of England. The Indian team went on to level the series 2-2 with a miraculous win at the Oval.

KKR is where I belong: Abhishek Nayar on his exit from Indian teamFormer India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar was sacked from his role in the aftermath of Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Nayar broke his silence on the matter after joining WPL side UP Warriorz as their head coach.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
